theorem putnam_1970_a4
(x : ℕ → ℝ)
(hxlim : Tendsto (fun n => x (n+2) - x n) atTop (𝓝 0))
: Tendsto (fun n => (x (n+1) - x (n))/(n+1)) atTop (𝓝 0) := by
  have h₁ : Tendsto (fun n => x (n+2) - x n) atTop (𝓝 0) := hxlim
  have h₂ : Tendsto (fun n => (x (n+1) - x n)/(n+1)) atTop (𝓝 0) := by
    have h₃ : (fun n => (x (n+1) - x n)/(n+1)) = (fun n => (1/(n+1)) * (x (n+1) - x n)) := by
      ext n
      ring
    rw [h₃]
    have h₄ : Tendsto (fun n => (1/(n+1 : ℝ)) * (x (n+1) - x n)) atTop (𝓝 0) := by
      have h₅ : Tendsto (fun n => x (n+1) - x n) atTop (𝓝 0) := by
        have h₆ : (fun n => x (n+1) - x n) = (fun n => x (n+1) - x n) := rfl
        convert h₁.comp (tendsto_add_atTop_nat 1) using 1
        ext n
        simp
      have h₇ : Tendsto (fun n => (1/(n+1 : ℝ))) atTop (𝓝 0) := by
        apply tendsto_const_nhds.div_atTop
        exact tendsto_atTop_add_const_right atTop 1 (tendsto_id)
      -- Use the fact that the product of a function tending to 0 and a bounded function tends to 0.
      have h₈ : Continuous (fun x : ℝ => (1/(x+1 : ℝ))) := by
        continuity
      have h₉ : Tendsto (fun n => (1/(n+1 : ℝ)) * (x (n+1) - x n)) atTop (𝓝 (0 * 0)) := by
        apply Tendsto.mul h₇ h₅
      simp at h₉
      exact h₉
    exact h₄
  exact h₂
